review: Only one star because the food was good. We went there for a late lunch today at 3pm. There was hardly anyone in this restaurant...maybe 10 customers. As far as I could tell the staff was 4-5 waiters, 1 host, 1 manager, 2 busers and the cooks.  We waited forever for anyone to come over to us. Finally the manager noticed us and came over and took our order.  Another person brought our drinks, a different person our appetizer and yet another our entree salads.  The host did come back by to say hi but NO ONE ELSE EVER CAME TO CHECK ON US. We needed water. When we finally grew tired of looking at  staff who would not make eye contact with us we finally just stopped someone who had not been to our table and asked if she could find out who our wait person was and get our check. She literally had to ask every single wait person and then ended up asking the manager who was sitting out inn the dining room talking to some folks and still could not get the check. Finally someone else who had not been to our table came by with the check. Needless to say I tipped accordingly since there was little service and I had no idea whom to tip.   My recommendation is to go when they are swamped because apparently they get all caught up in their side work when it slows down between lunch and dinner. I have eaten there when it was busy and it was fine. This was crazy bad. Maybe that is why some restaurants close for the afternoon?

This place is kind of small for a CPK because it used to be a CPK ASAP.  The staff is really friendly, but the food comes out less than thrilling.  There is no presentation and it looks like it was carelessly thrown together.

I love CPK. I love their pizza, pastas, and their salmon dishes. Some of their salads are pretty solid, other not so much. Must try dishes: Chicken Milanese: I make this dish once every week, inspired by CPK's simple recipe: arugula, parmasean, tomatoes, lemon, and panko crusted chicken. Chipotle Chicken Pizza: spicy and full of flavor! The bf's favorite Roasted Garlic Chicken Pizza: I love garlic! This location is perfect: a mere mile from home! The only downside is parking. It could get pretty awful.

Yes..I know CPK is a chain but I don't really care...i'm always really happy with my food and sometimes you want a bbq chicken pizza.  CPK used to be one of our go-to places in high school, before we enjoyed the better eats of LA and really before we could afford the better eats of LA. Anyways, I've only ordered take-out from this location and sounds like the calls are taken at a call center so they are pretty good at pushing additions on you like soda and dessert...a bit annoying but hey, someone has to pay for the call center.  Otherwise, no mistakes and service at least with take-out was pretty great.

I got off  Wednesday afternoon and a little bit hungry. I order an appetizer (the wedge salad.) And the wedge salad was very fresh and love it !!! and I order Jumbalaya. I love it !!! and I liked alot. !!!  Hot and very fresh dish. What I mean Hot is. They   didn't served cold food. Like the one CPK. place in Beverly Hills, on Beverly Blvd....that place it sting and nasty dirty I was there last weekend (Saturday) having lunch with my girlfriend and in count food poised and when I got home I got sick. please don't eat there, the CPK. on Beverly Blvd, it was dirty and nasty. Come eat here at this place CPK this place on 10704 Venice Blvd., Culver city, CA. 90232. I love this place (CPK.) Love it !!! The food it is delicious and fresh made daily. That why I give them five (5) stars. !!! Good place for a quick small craving. The best time to come here to eat any time after 3:33 PM !!! I love it !!! 5 * * * * * stars Good food !!!

The food tastes great and the customer service was extra friendly. However, the food took a very long time and we were greatly disappointed by the new portions.  The large pizza gave my children too tiny slices each and they were still hungry.  The chip portion was a joke!  After leaving there spending 35 dollars, my children still wanted me to cook them more food at home!

Let me start by saying that I work and manage in the high end service industry, and I expect the highest standards from my employees and myself. I usually avoid chains because the local mom and pop and one off restaurants have a level of service that exceeds all chains...I was pleasantly surprised upon my visit here last night. Never have I seen in a chain the attentiveness and spread of cheeriness of the staff that I experienced last night. Our server (Kaitlyn) was so nice to us and the entire staff as a whole. The hostess seen us coming from a distance through the window and I seen her run to get the door for us. Chains usually do not have this attentiveness to detail in my experience. My wife and I were "wowed" last night because this location did not feel like a CPK or a chain restaurant at all. With all the attentiveness to detail and quality of the staff I felt like I could of easily been in one of the high end mom and pop local restaurants. Wow.

Well I went here with 12 others, food was OK, I honestly think that the price us too high for some of the stuff they offer. I had a pasta and I truly believe I do 100% better at home, and pizza it's OK too, I just believe it's not all that after all.

Totally fine. Really. Seriously.  If you're like me, the whole California Pizza Kitchen / CPK thing feels like stepping back in time ... to the end of the previous century. The novelty of fusion pizzas and pastas has worn off, but this location on Venice met our needs. We were in a hurry and didn't have time to try a new restaurant. Our server was great at taking our order quickly. We were able to be on our way in 45 minutes to make an appointment. Kudos to our server! The free bread was notably not noteworthy. I nibbled at the soft interior of one piece  that was only made more palatable by butter. Meh. Jambalaya was her order. It's a hearty bowl of Linguine mixed with a slightly spicy Jambalaya Sauce and loaded with Blackened Chicken, Shrimp, Andouille Sausage, Ham, and Scallions. It's neither mind-blowing or terrible. It's filling. An easy order when in doubt. A "BLT" Pizza was my choice because I couldn't decide between pizza or salad and the "BLT" is basically both together. The pizza is baked with Bacon and Mozzarella and then topped with Lettuce, Tomatoes, and Mayonnaise. It was exactly what I wanted when I added some Cholula. I was satisfied. Parking is free in the shared (& busy) strip mall lot. The Culver City California Pizza Kitchen met our expectations. We were able to get in, eat something filling, and be on to the rest of our day. No reason not choose them again when a similar situation arises.

Why do I keep coming back. There always making mistakes on takeout orders. Never have any problems with the Beverly Hills location. And the same dishes seem to be better there. But it's all about location. And I'll probably be back.

I was never really a fan of CPK, but this was right across the street and I learned to enjoy a few menu items.  The people working were pretty nice even though they work in that tiny cramped restaurant all day.  My main complaint is that I ordered curbside before, got there on time, waited in my car and no one came.  I had to go in myself (not a problem, but why even call is curb-side service and ask for my car model and color if you don't care?). Definitely no tip on that note..

Food was awesome, service was a joke. Took 2 hours to eat here. my son ordered a kids traditional pizza and they thought he wanted a full size regular pizza, so we got charged for the bigger one. Even after he ordered a kiwi fantasy in a kids cup.. When I asked why they charged us for a regular menu pizza instead of a kids, they said it was because he ordered a traditional cheese pizza, and traditional means the regular size. I showed our waiter the kids menu and it was called,"traditional pizza" on his menu. Not sure why there was a discrepancy there....surely they didn't think my 50lb son would eat a whole one himself? Waitor did not correct it, and put it on our receipt still. I just wanted to leave and not fight over it. There were also long periods in between our drinks, appetizers, food....they didn't bring us any napkins when they brought out our appetizer,so we sat there with greasy hands till they came back 10 min later,no forks when our food came...one thing after another. Never going back
Such awesome service here I'm really impressed we order from here regularly curbside pickup and the experience is always pleasant. I'm really impressed by the team here.

I do miss the CPK A.S.A.P. The ease of coming in and getting a table. Now it's more of a restaurant where you wait give seated. Not bad but with two hungry boys, it can get ugly. The menu has changed. Tried new items and was impressed. Will be returning but possibly with friends.

For me, a CPK is a fall back or a plan B.  I don't ever crave the pizza because the ingredients don't taste fresh and most of them are rather bland.  The salads are better.  The place is open, inviting and comfortable.  The service is attentive and friendly.  You get what you expect.

This location is on the small side but it's okay.  The food is consistently good and the atmosphere pleasant.  There's a take-out window and take-out parking spaces in case you choose to eat elsewhere.   Service is quick and the servers pleasant.  I usually order the four cheese ravioli with a wedge salad and a strawberry lemonade.  Their bread is delicious, so is the Chinese chicken salad.
This is like my third kitchen, It's a go to place. Its also a great place to have a meeting after 1:10pm the place will calm.

This is the worst CPK location I've ever been to! It's sad because I really do love to eat at CPK in general. So we started off with the same exact appetizer that we've had the last 20 times we ate at a CPK, and it was HALF the size as usual! It wasn't really a big deal on its own - just annoying. Then my salad came (the same one I get every single time) with probably quadrouple the amount of dressing, making it so tangy that it was burning my mouth. My boyfriend's and my friend's entrees were fine. I wanted to ask our waitress Angel if she could get me a salad with the dressing on the side instead. She went to every single table around us except ours for at least 40 minutes. We were all staring at her to try to get her attention - nothing. My boyfriend eventually went to the hostess, who he said was very friendly, who got the manager for us. We explained the situation to him, and instead of apologizing just told me he would take the salad off my bill and bring me a new one to go. He was totally stoned by the way. Then our waitress came back and yelled at us for telling her manager that she wasn't being attentive. She clearly had some anger issues... I was really awkward and horrible.
This cpk is not one of the best. Service is consistently slow, although the food is usually pretty good (as long as you aren't waiting for extra sauce so long that your pasta gets cold).

First off the waitress said it would be about 25 minutes, it actually took 55 minutes, they were clearly understaffed, CPK is screwing up.  Take care of the customer, that is not good service especially when i am already on the fence about CPK, a future visit will definitely not happen, at least at the point when I complained you should have at least kicked in some garlic bread or something to try to make the situation a little better. O well there are plenty more pizza places that will appreciate my business. Try  The COOP down on National
The minute I walked in there I was like oh no.... Small place not large enough for the  people waiting.  Pizza took 55 minutes really? Servers were inattentive... Food mas mediocre.

Now for a chain restaurant to get 4 stars out of me, they have to be doing something right at the location I visit. This place had some of the "corporate feel" that I dislike; but the staff were personable, and didn't seem to be on a script. We were in at an off time about 4:00 PM, well after lunch, and well before dinner. The heated patio had a heater not working so we asked to be moved inside as the ladies in the party were chilly. I was surprised by the quality of the food and the service. Again I felt like this location was trying to be more upscale than most chain Pizza joints. All the veggies seemed fresh not processed, canned or frozen. I was pleased. I will visit a CPK again rather than fight my children when that's what they are asking for... Sláinte!

Its decent i suppose... I wasn't too impressed with their service as the waitress seemed to have rushed me because she was a little bit too chatty with another table, Also the food took forever to get to us... not to mention we sat by the bar. I dont think I will really come here much... :(

Usually, I wouldn't review a chain restaurant.  I just wanted to point out the convenience of their online ordering.  Very cool and efficient.  There is even an option for you to select to have them bring your order to your car! Food is 2-stars.

The service at this location is awful. I wish I knew the name of the guy so you could avoid at all costs (he was an Arab looking guy about 24 yrs old maybe). Very slow....and hardly came by our table....ever. I'd try to make eye contact with him so I could flag him over to refill my drink and he NEVER looked up at any point. Oh, and that drink never got refilled even though it was ALL GONE. How do you serve when you're laser focused on the ground. Then he kept having all these conversations with other servers. Mind you, it was 4pm and not busy! The other half of the dining room was empty! The food was ok..but I wasn't expecting to be blown away. But, there is absolutely no excuse for poor service.

We tend to go here not during peak times and the wait then is never long.  It's a very small location as it used to be a CPK ASAP.  I like how they converted it.  It's clean, new, and revamped.  Parking is free and it's not so touristy.  Food is the same CPK food you get everywhere else.  Service is OK.  Kinda fake.   That's the one area that I think the Santa Monica location improves on.
pretty good wish I could have ordered something else will be coming back to try a different dish

The chopped Italian Salad was great. The pizza was your usual CPK. My friend had the Carnitas Pizza and he really enjoyed it. The bread that they serve now is much better than previous ( don't forget that you may have to ask for it).

Im pretty disappointed with myself for giving this place a 3 star but it has to deal with the quality of service displayed today.  I have been going to CPK all my life and love the food. It is excellent food. So tasty,yummy and just delicious. I have been to this CPK multiple times but today, something changed and I am writing a review for the MANAGER on duty primarily.  It all began when myself and the family all in for a nice quick lunch before my parents were on their way somewhere else. My parents rarely every come down and see me so I was kind of excited for them to come. We have been to this CPK before and well no complaints ever. But today was different. The place was not busy and our waiter was super nice and super friendly. He was assertive and was always making sure that we had what we needed. He took our order and then it all started... But... roughly 10 min pass by and two tables down apparently CPK was having a staff meeting. The lady who I think is the manager of the place kind of shouts... oh im gonna order all the appetizers for you guys... its gonna be great. While my family and I  are sitting, you could hear the manager and the staff kind of over bearing us with their conversation got kind of hectic. So the clock is ticking and its about 20min and we still havent gotten our food. Of course, I had a feeling that the chefs were making the managers food priority and not ours when we have been sitting waiting patiently for our food. So long behold they got served before us and we were getting kind of pissed off and then fiinaly our food came out except mine. It took longer and well the CHEF then decided to come and tell me that they didnt have a certain sauce for my pizza and ask me if thats okay and at this point I was so hungry I dont care sure why not. Well the cook then told me okay dont worry about I will take it off the bill. So yum yum chicken bum the food was fantastic but then something else came up... the cook said we would get the food for free i mean my meal and nope he didnt make sure that it was taken off. He actually noticed that it wasnt and came and checked and then kind of just went the other way after he realized our waiter forgot to take it off. Its not the fact that he didnt take it off its just the whole ordeal that you said something and didnt do it.  I am sorry CPK but this was one of the worst visits I have ever had in my life here... step it up. Stop making yourself priority and think of others.

The CPK food is generally good but at these prices I want service too. We were at a late lunch, not even prime busy time. We asked for bread ASAP but didn't get any and the kids needed food immediately. Our waitress, Jennifer, had much better things to do than check on us or realize we're starving since she spent most of her time chatting with a man sitting at the bar.  Never checked back after the food was dropped off and my new Wedge salad was inedible, drowning in dressing - but i couldn't tell her because she never came over to ask. Someone else dropped our pizzas/pasta and we were 1/2 done before she even came over and we had already asked 2 other people for Parmesan but no one really seemed to care what we needed.  Very disappointing visit, i'll stick to other locations if I CPK at all after this.

location: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
review: I wanted something quick and easy for dinner so I ordered an appetizer from the Take-out restaurant, called ASAP.  It took over 20 minutes for my food to come to me.  Most of the time, I could see my already cooked wraps sitting waiting to be boxed.  Terrible service.  This place is not ASAP.   Also, they do not have any beers on tap at the bar, yet think its a good idea to have pictures of taps and delicious beers with nice frothy heads.

Online ordering lacks quality control.  I thought I ordered a caramelized peach salad, but the peaches were missing. Really? Is no one looking at the food being put into containers? I gave 2 stars because I called and my meal was refunded back to my card, but this place just feels like it can't keep up. With so many other great options to choose from in Culver City, I doubt I'll be going back any time soon.
Tai Chicken Pizza.  As much as I tried, I kept ordering this over and over and over.  I loved it.  I love getting takeout here.  Great pizza(s)......  :)

I hate CPK on principal and only came here because my bf had a gift card. This location isn't half-bad though. The staff is nice, food is alright but I think a lot of there stuff is sent pre-packaged because we couldn't make a substitution on a salad since it was pre-mixed?? Whatever. There's a huge parking lot shared with the shopping center.

Very disappointed in CPK at this location in specific. It's small so you would think their service would be fast,and excellent,But all contrary. We found our selves waiting to be greeted by our server 10 minutes after we where seated. We ordered an appetizer to munch on while our food was ready, it turned out we waited 45 minutes for our food, and despite us asking on various time for our appetizer it was served along with our food. Our server never asked us if we needed more drinks, nor if the food was good, nothing. Ive been to many CPKs, and never had such horrible experiences. The table next to us who was seated right after us also waited, but they where smart enough to just get up and leave, so props to them. So disappointing CPK u should be ashamed and close the  location seriously !!!

The service was slow, waited forever to get a refill, but the food was good. Not great, but good. The bread is different now, no more butter, hello warm bread and oil & vinegar. Dine at your own risk.
I get take out here frequently. It's a good fallback plan if you can't think of anything to eat. The dining area is small compared to other CPKs.

If I can give ZERO star, I'll do that. Have been waiting for almost 1 hour but never got the order. We've seriously asked a couple of waiters if the order is ready, they told us they were gonna check but never came back giving us an answer. I am not coming back. If you want cal pizza kitchen, go somewhere else otherwise you'll get pissed off.

The tequila fettucini is damn good.  The restaurant is a bit small but most of the wait staff seems to be on top of their game.  Although I noticed that the table that was seated after us got their food first, the waitress saw me looking but served us some complimentary bread and told us that the order was coming.  A bit annoyed because I was starving, all was forgotten because the food was good and the Mojito cooled me down.  Yummy...

Terrible service! The waiter seemed nice enough,but his actions proved less than stellar. I was not offered bread while I waited on my order, and when it did arrive, only part of it was ready.  I had to wait almost 10min for the rest of my order. Then it turns out that the bread was not what I was expecting when it came  to taste or price. It was small and not even close  to being  worth $5.95, but I was willing to give it a try. It was far too random of a flavour mix for me.But my waiter never noticed.   At most he'd give an off handed "how you doing?" as he zoomed by. He also never asked if I had a Pizza Dough account. Didn't offer me a to go box for the bread I'd taken a bite out of,nor Dr he enquire as to why I didn't finish it. Overall slow inattentive and off putting.
The food was excellent and well priced for lunch, went there with friends and will probably become one of our regular stops when i am in the area  Tried their chinese chicken salad and it was a bomb

this particular CPK is horrible. the last three times i have come here the wait staff has either messed my order up or failed to perform their job. these three visits happened over a span of about 2 months. i will not be coming back. the last time i was here my pasta took 45 mins and the waitress who took my order forgot what i looked like and stored my food in the heat box even though i never left the waiting area.  today, after waiting 30 mins i noticed that the person who ordered after me picked his food up. when i asked what was happening with my food i was never really told, the waitress scrambled around and after some attempts to find out where my food was in the kitchen i was nervously apologized to a few times at which point i walked out, i didn't have patience to wait for them to explain the reason my food wasn't ready. they either never started my order or they gave my food to a delivery order, which meant i basically had to wait twice as long for my food as i should have. the sense i get is that the staff is poorly managed and when its busy they just cant seem to hold it together, and they're busy everytime i go in there.  for the amount of business they generate at this location (and all cpk locations from what i've seen) they can afford to hire trained staff or to at least get their current staff trained properly.  thanks for reading.

I been to different branches of CPK since I moved to Ca. I liked it. Friday we went to have dinner there. I wanted to try something new I asked for thai pizza. Definetly this was the worst pizza ever !!! Why did I gave 4 stars then? Appetezeir was very good and also service deserves 5 star. They are so nice. When I told that i did not like it. They changed the pizza and  serve us a free big size pizza and did not charge for the Thai one.  then we enjoyed our second yummy pizza.

Came to eat at this CPK with my best friend today just to have some girl time and chit chat about life. I usually have a good time here when I come with my other friends but today wasn't a good experience which forced me into writing this review. Had lunch today around 2pm and our servers name was Keith, he started off well didn't come by much to check on us but nothing was needed since our food is always good and nothing ever comes out wrong. Once we slowly started to finish our meals Keith basically avoided our table and never really checked on us at all just to see if we were doing okay, or even strike up a conversation. As a server I feel like you should build a relationship with your tables so that way they have nothing but nice things to say about you (I work in a restaurant in Marina Del Rey that's well known and I know what our guests like & don't like) but Keith didn't do that at all, he became snobby in a way and somehow tried to act like he was better then us. I understand I'm young, didn't order any alcoholic drinks because it was 2pm and I could've gone to my job and gotten them for a cheaper price.  So on to the bill, once Keith dropped the bill my friend and I wanted to pay separately and usually that's NEVER a problem and nothing EVER goes wrong when I come to this location, today was something different. His attitude went from bad to worse once he dropped that check, I work 6 days a week and get paid every Friday so I know I have a very nice amount of money in my account, Keith processed my card, said it was declined, threw the declined receipts on the table along with my card and walked away. Not only did I have proof that I have more then I should in my account, but he wasn't humble about anything. Once I walked over to an ATM got cash out he proceeded to act like I was no longer at his table, just plain rude.  Needless to say this server shouldn't be serving, or anything else for that matter. I work at a restaurant and he's not someone we'd ever hire. CPK in Culver City you have a bad apple, and you either need to get rid of this bad apple or have a serious disciplinary talk with him. I might come back to this location, I might not. I'd rather stay on my side of town and come to the CPK in marina del Rey, where I have nice servers since everything is better by the water. But if I walk in and Keith is there, I'd rather not get served by him.

i've been twice to this location, and both times the servers have been very attentive. I like the salads here and tortilla soup, very tasty. I didnt like the pizza as much, so I won't be ordering one next time. But the soups and salads are worth coming for.

I called for a take out around 05:46pm on 12/20/2013...today. I probably arrived around 06:15pm and left about 06:35pm....or so. The one thing I will remember is the serve. The lady who took my order was nice  She took the time to go over the menu on the different types of pizzas. The other lady with the glasses and yellow shirt....she recognized that the cook did not put enough bell peppers on the pizza and send it back....that's when I was afraid because when a cook see his food coming back he is pissed off....anyway...the other lady with black pants on...  placed discount tickets in my bag and asked me to return. These ladies were very nice and the customer serve was wonderful. The pizza during that time was awful. I took two bites and I new it was rushed and it even looked rushed You can tell how the cook put the red onions and bell peppers on as if he just through it on top of a half cooked pizza.I gave it to one of the homeless because I did not want my colon to be cleaned tonight...but the lady in the glasses with the yellow shirt was very nice to offer me some tea and honey which was very relaxing.  I would like to give a high rating on the serve. I will come back on a day when the district supervisor is in...so the cooks will do an excellent job while the supervisor is there.

This place is the horrible restaurant I went in my life  Since I got there the serves was really terribly noooooo organization  food cool Anyways everything for was nightmare The night horrible  Make it Better pls Chance the personal they don't deserved to be there .

I don't know how people can give this location more than 1 or 2 stars. The service is absolutely horrible and management is almost non-existent.  My wife likes the location but I rather would go to the Marina del Rey location. 5 times in a row it has taken over 15 minutes to even get our drink order. If you get the Asian waiter. You barely get refills because he just disappears. Also he never seems to serve your order either. Other seem to always bring the food.   I have onky seen out waiter come by twiceThe table behind us didnt get their order taken for over half an hour. They were a large party.  I hate this location.  Only saving grace is the food is good

The Moroccan-spiced chicken salad was alright.  Tasted kind of plain to me.  The Original BBQ Chicken tasted a lot better.  I normally like the salads here, but for some reason, this time around it sucked; it was too plain even with the dressing. The Spaghetti Bolognese was alright.  I think our food wasn't that hot, that's why it didn't taste as great.  The Asparagus + Spinach Spaghettini was alright.   As for the baked stuff, the cookies were typical tasting cookies, sweet and all.  My friend loved the brownies.  In her words, they were "to die for." I think I liked the pizza the most from this place.  My work had ordered a lot of pizza.  I pretty much tried all the pizzas on the menu.  We ordered the Original BBQ Chicken, Habenero Carnitas, The Works, Mushroom Pepperoni Sausage, Pepperoni, White Pizza, First Cheese + Fresh Tomato, California Veggie, Jamaican Jerk Chicken, and The Meat Cravers.  I tried every slice of those and I can say you can't go wrong with any of these.  Mmmm pizza...

Went yesterday for lunch with my co worker. Sat outside it was a nice day. We both ordered the Italian chopped salad. We also had the strawberry mango cooler. The salad was lacking the chicken. We only found a few small pieces for 15.00. The service was good, eve though I had to ask for more bread twice.  All in all not sure I would o back, as with tip it cost me 41.00 for two salads and two of the strawberry mango coolers with no liquor. The CPK in Simi Valley is much better and has more meat in their salads.

Hate reviewing chains sometimes, because it's pretty standard. Service, food, decor, location, parking... all just ok. Only stopped by here for a bite and they didn't better or worsen my expectations.

This is a great restaurant, me and my friend go here at least once a week . the chicken dumplings , pizzas, salads and grilled salmon and pastas are very tasty . the service is wonderful. you get what you pay for. their chocolate soufflé is fantastic. I recommend this restaurant 100% !!!

Terrible. The only saving grace was that our waiter was attentive, but he kept referring to my date as "big guy." Stop. Please stop. Then our appetizer seemed to just be taken off a warmer - it wasn't fresh tasting and was lukewarm. My entree was watery and bland (probably because I got the shrimp and zucchini "pasta" under the lighter fare) but dang, CPK. You could have at least steamed off the extra liquids when you took it out of the bag. His pasta was alright, but nothing special. I wonder if it's just this location as I've had way better experiences at the Beverly Center location.

Food was fresh, fast and reasonable.  Staff was outstanding!!!!  Everyone was welcoming, attentive, and friendly.  My kids love their pizza.  The manager Letty was awesome and went above and beyond for our family.  A special thanks to her and your amazing staff.

Worst service I have ever witnessed in a restaurant. Went to this location during lunch so they weren't even that busy! Had to ask for hot sauce 3 times to 3 different people to finally get it. Took them 10 mins at least to come say hello after we were seated and ask us what we want to drink. Horrible service would never ever ever come back to this location

The best dish there is CHICKEN MILANESE (breaded chicken breast woth arugula salad)! And you MUST to have butter cake for desert (comes with scoop of icecream) YUM! The restrooms are always clean.  I like the patio outside. The customer service is good :)

I wouldn't typically leave a review for a chain, but our server here was pretty great.  Reuben took care of us from the start. We didn't realize this spot had changed from a CPK asap to a regular cpk. My friend was pretty disappointed that they no longer had their soup and sandwich combos. The menu was a little different due to the changes.  We both were just looking to have a snack. We each had a bowl of the tortilla soup, which until this day, is still my favorite thing at CPK. I am pretty obsessed with that soup - not sure how they do it. But I can assure you that you can never go wrong with that bowl.  After our soups we decided to order an item off the small bites menu. We settled on the iceberg salad (I can't remember the name of the item). It was the poorest executed dish I have ever eaten. It's literally iceberg lettuce with blue cheese, bacon bits and a little bit of hard boiled eggs. Something you could make easily at home. So I highly advise you don't order that off the menu.

Came here with my friend on veterans day, I got a free pizza and we split the cost of his meal and appetizer.   With the free pizza it still costed us $30 plus, the food was pretty average for the price and my friend and I both agree that  cpk's setting is not as nice as other restaurants at the same price range.  First I just got to stop eating out because I'd not so healthy, secondly I don't think cpk is worth the price.  However the staff are friendly, that seems like the common feel from other yelpers also.  Also what ups with the lights in front of the tv's? I am not a interior designer but I know for sure that's bad positions for the lights.   Probably would of gave two stars if I didn't dined on veterans night.

I legitimately had the 5 Star experience all because of a great server. I ordered my meal and when it came it had onions on it... which wasn't stated on the menu. I am not one to make a big deal and I figure I would just pick them off..... and Jennifer (the server) went above and beyond... she walked by as I was pulling them off and asked if I wanted it remade.... I let her know it was not necessary because I didn't ask for them to be off when I ordered and that it was no big deal... but Jennifer told me to not even worry and she was gonna have it remade but left the meal there to "munch on" while I waited for the new one. I mean it was so above and beyond and I was not expecting it because I didn't think to ask to order it that way. I let her manager know who already had gone through the ringer with customers behind us because they felt "entitled" to not be charged for splitting of a meal.... IT IS ON THE MENU AS A CHARGE. They kept saying they have never been charged and were freaking out about it... granted they were like in their 70's... but seriously.... it is in writing, no big surprise there. But their manager was gracious. I believe good service deserves manager acknowledgment as much as people who give bad service.  For a small CPK location... it was like a mom and pop deal with the attention received, and a good one to go to anytime :)
The avocado roll is amazing!!! I love their mango Mojito. Is a great place for Friday night dinners with either friends or the kids.

very poor host service. could not put together a table of six for us. but when we walked past later, they had a table for six enjoying their dinner.  others were waiting a long time to be seated - just not friendly or helpful.
Love CPK but have to give this location a low rating due to no parking available.  There's a gym in the same lot so forget about parking here after 5 pm.
Ambiance was dead, took to long to take my order and get it correctly. I don't see myself coming here again.

Oh how I love the California pizza kitchen. Oh how I love garlic fettuccine - - and fusilli with broccoli and sun-dried tomatoes! Oh how I love barbecue chicken pizza! But it's not on my diet anymore. And I can't go there anymore. And the food is too high in calories for anyone watching their weight. Everything there is so high in calories - - even the salads because of the way they are made that it's not a good choice if you're trying to maintain or lose weight.

I came in today. And it was the worst service ever. They wanted to put me in a small table. I told them I'm eating for my son. So they asked me you are waiting. Three times. Then the manager Brandon comes and asks me. Then the waiter Mario with long hair asks the same question. In 5 minutes my son parks and comes in. I don't see Mario anymore. I asked the hostess to call our waiter Mario, she never came back. So then a young lady (waitress) came and asks us if we needed help cause we seemed to be waiting for a while. I replied yes I don't feel like spending the night. Two thumbs up for the young waitress but the rest was a terrible experience.

Terrible all the way. This location is one of the worst I have visited. Not only did we wait about 1 hour 10 min for our food to arrive but the salads that were specifically paid extra attention to by the server and manager were completely wrong! I literally walked out! The manager made no apologies and just looked at me like I was crazy. Never coming to this one again!
They saved the day! Excellent service. Delicious food. Close to home. Red velvet cake is amazing.

Mom and I each had salads.  Bread and dip was good too.  We shared key lime pie.  T'was a nice girly meal.  It almost felt like sacrilege to eat at CPK and not have their namesake pizza, but that's life.

This place started life as a CPK Express then changed its name to CPK but even though the bathroom is a little better it's never quite become a real CPK.  The food is okay but it's not quite as fresh or as good as a "real" CPK.  The service also isn't quite up to par, they're plenty friendly but they're prone to mistakes.

5-star hospitality and service, but 1-star pizza... I guess that averages to 3 stars, but I don't want Yelpers to be misled.  As for what I got, I had the "Untraditional Cheese" pizza, which is really like a personal pizza-shaped cheese bread. Where's the sauce?! And, in the description it says they added "more" cheese, but I don't know where it went. My pizza was as dry as leftovers and left much to be desired. And, having spent many years working in pizzerias way back when, and having indulged in many a slice over my time on this Earth, I will say: if you can't do the basic cheese pie right, the fancy stuff won't deliver either.  Bottom line: Maybe their other non-pizza dishes are good enough, but for $11.29 plus tax, forget the Untraditional and head down Washington Blvd. to Blaze Pizza instead where you get about the same volume of food for 2/3rds the price and 3x the flavor.

I was here about 2 weeks ago. We sat on the patio. Everyone was super friendly. However the service was less than stellar.  Our waiter was a hot mess. He got parts of our order wrong and then it took forever for any of our food to start coming. Our waiter would just disappear for a significant amount of time. The manager had to step in to help him. Which is fine. But this waiter was just overwhelmed and we couldn't figure out why. It wasn't insanely crowded.  But it wasn't just him. The waitress that had the section right next to us, she was hella slow and a hot mess too!!! The people in her section were pissed at how slow she was and she was getting their orders wrong too!! The only thing that saved the day for us were the really good mojitos!! Lol

This location has some big issues. Came in for take out, and it took twice as long as promised to get my food. It was only when I got to my final destination (a five minute drive) that I realized the hot food was cold, the salad was drowning in water, and they forgot the dressing. The food quality also isn't what it used to be, sadly. I used to love this place...

Been here once. I really give it 2.5 stars. Likes: -Got seated right away on a Friday night. -Food is the same as all CPK's. Dislikes: -Service was horrible, which I don't get why considering there were many waiters/waitresses and this CPK is pretty small. Had to wait a long time to order and the waiter only came to take our order after we kept trying to flag him down. Also, we had to flag down the waiter again after we finished eating to get the check and to-go boxes. -There is a parking lot but it definitely gets crowded. -CPK is generally pretty expensive. Recommend: Food, yes. But overall service/experience, no.
My favorite place to eat....when I want a great salad & pasta Bolognese *add mushrooms! delicious .great service!

If you're thinking of going here, just go to Ralph's across the street and buy one of CPK's frozen pizzas. You'll save time, money and it will taste exactly the same! I haven't been here in a really long time so my boyfriend and I went. We soon realized why we didn't go there in so long. The pizza is so plain and tastes just like the frozen ones (but more expensive) and their Chinese Chicken salad was swimming in dressing, it was so overbearing.  We also sat outside and the waiter never came outside to check on us until the end. I won't be back.

This Place is More like a Chuck E. Cheese. The staff need to know how to take command of their Guests, kids should NOT be running up and down the aisles, and jumping on seats disturbing other guests.  Difficult to Enjoy Dinner with my Fiancée and Newborn Son with the Chuck E. Cheese Atmosphere and blatant lack of People skills from the Host Staff.  Our Server Rex was Great
Super slow service. Food is pretty bleh! I got my pizza partially burnt! It's not worth it! It's expensive for the service and quality!
Good customer service! Pasta was solid. I would definitely go back again. Rex was a great server and even turn on the nhl playoffs for me to watch. Keep up the good work!

Wait staff and ToGo cashiers are friendly and attentive  The food, not so much. Side of salmon for Ceasar Salad came in the firm of 6 tiny deep fried nuggets. Definitely  not a good deal for a salad that cost $16.50.

Poor customer service (and didn't care). My friend called in an order for pickup and upon arriving 30 minutes later (which is how long we were told the wait would be) they told us that no order has been received under my friends name nor was there any order placed with the items she orders. We had to wait another 45 minutes for the food and the night-time manager did not even apologize nor offer us any discount. We showed him that we called the number for his specific branch but he did not seem to care that we called in an order that was not fulfilled. When ordering via phone, I'd recommend calling twice - once for placing your order and once again before you go to pick it up to confirm that the order is ready.

We came to this pace around 5pm on a Sunday. There was no host when we walked in. Finally Melvin came over to seat us. I ordered spinach artichoke dip and my boyfriend ordered Hawaiian bbq pizza & a Shirley temple. While we waited Melvin brought out some hard bread. The artichoke dip was overwhelmed with artichoke & spinach with a lot less cheese. My boyfriend ate all but one slice of his pizza. The wait for the pizza was pretty long I was almost done with the dip when they finally brought the pizza out. I ordered a Tiramisu but I've had it better as an actual cake versus the cream custard way. I ordered a margarita initially but Melvin never brought it out and we weren't billed for it so I guess he forgot. I won't be back to this place again. Same food but better quality at a BJ's brewhouse. Food could've tasted better...shrug.
Came with family very friendly and caring.  Food has gotten a lot betterand better and the service has improved 1000 fold.

Ruben totally forgot to put in our appetizer when we asked about it he blamed it on the chef being busy even though it was a dead night. Told us the manger would do something about it but it was still on the bill not worth the money won't be back unfortunately
The place is remodel and looks good. The service is way to slow and they bring the wrong orders.

I never give 5 stars. But Irving at this location was absolutely amazing. We had the best experience because of him. He was very attentive and personable. I have had one awful experience here so was very hesitant to come back. He completely changed my negative feelings toward CPK!
My friends and I came here a week ago and we just don't like how cold it constantly is inside! The food is meh and the service is lacking in some parts when they're busy.
The food was excellent. I'm always extra picky when I take my daughter with me. Staff and management get an extra star for their professional and great customer service.

If you're thinking of eating salmon.  This is not the place!!  I had a Cesar Salad with grilled Salmon.  It was over cooked, dry and hard as a crouton.  I didn't get greeted by my server 8 min after I had sat down.  Food took 34 min!!!!  Just for a salmon salad. !   Server didn't come back to my table to ask if my food was good. In fact she came when I was done eating.      I wouldn't come back , considering the restaurant was not busy.

I've ordered takeout quite a bit from this location, but I'm taking a break from them until they get their act together.  I've had long waits here before, but tonight I waited 35 minutes beyond the time I was told the food would be ready when I ordered it.   The place wasn't even half full so I don't get how it takes almost an hour to put together two salads. Based on the scant amount of chicken included in both of them, that extra time wasn't spent grilling.
Super fast service greats waitress great desert 5 stars for me. Order the butter cake. With vanilla ice cream btw Megan you are awesome and pretty.

I had a terrible experience with the curbside assistance.  I pre-ordered for our company 3 days before the event and put a time of 1130am.  I arrived 5 minutes early and called the number and the girl stated she will get the order only to find out it was not ready.  20 minutes passed by and finally the manager came out and said it would be another 10 minutes so total wait time was 30 minutes...The manager said he would give a discount but what is the purpose of having curbside assistance and CPK is not prepared to handle an order that was given to them 3 days in advance (he blamed it on the quinoa not being ready for the salad).  I think the appropriate thing CPK should of did was called me and said it was running late and offer to deliver.  Well, I will not go there anymore because when the order came out finally (I had to go inside to ask if it was even ready) they did not give me the discount they promised.  I have once heard, "fail to plan, plan to fail"  #badbusiness. Gina J.

A very busy place, even late at night!  Having trouble deciding what to order at the Take Out Counter, I created a little havoc ~ but they sorted everything out quickly  :)  The manager, Ruby, was very pleasant and cleared up the confusion.  Alfredo at the counter was friendly and efficient, multi-tasking several orders and coordinating with the staff to make sure everything was as ordered and ready to go.  This restaurant enjoys serving their customers and really wants to see them return.   A very pleasant and incredibly tasty dinner experience!  Love that petite wedge salad and the Mushroom, Sausage and Pepperoni pizza!   Service was fast and the meal sooooo tasty!!

Probably the worst take out service I have ever had! Walked into the restaurant to pickup my order I had called in and it was a zoo in there. The two girls at the takeout counter were extremely rude and unhelpful. It wasn't ready so I waited for a few minutes then I saw someone walk up with my food so I approached the counter. No one acknowledged me. So I asked if I could get my order and she said okay and walked away. She came back with a salad that was not what I ordered. So she left again. Myself and two other guests were looking at each other in disbelief at how rude they were to me. She tossed my food in a bag and handed it to me no silverware no bread. So I asked if I could get some and she said nothing didn't even acknowledge me and tossed it in my bag. So I saw the "manager" and walked over to him to ask him what was going on? He was shocked at how upset I was, he apologized and said he would talk to her. I agreed that it was better for him to talk to her then it would be for me to talk to her. Worst customer service by far.

Not sure why people have had such bad experiences here. At the very least, the lunch service is great here! I love coming her for quick comfort foods and the servers at lunch are so nice! I love that they have lunch combos that offer small portions as well as various appetizers, soups, and salads that could easily be entrees for light eaters! Perfect lunch option!

thin crust mushroom pizza was delicious, Waldorf salad was tasty and the large was big enough to share and bring some home. this place is popular with families lots of kids. decent dinner for two for around $30.
Called to place a curb side pick up order.  Got transferred to 5 different people in 5 minutes.  I hung up.  What happened to this place?

Food is standard CPK fare.  Servers are friendly. But wholly cow it takes forever to get a drink.  Literally when I order from the bar it takes 10 minutes to get my drink.  The guy chats with his people, fondles the food orders, etc. It would take a minute to make my drink, but alas I wait. :(

Placed a phone order for pick up and used the curbside service they offered. It was quick and the service was excellent. Although the food is a bit pricey , the ingredients are fresh and was made to order. The fish tacos are delicious and the BBQ chicken pizza is awesome.

Haven't had good service for a while now until I came here, Nancy was great, as soon as we finished our bread she came with more and she gave us refills without us asking great service . love the Thai chicken pizza it's delicious will be going back soon!!

I would never suggest this restaurant. Terrible take out experience! All I ordered was soup, salad, and guacamole. Not only were over 15 minutes late and skimmed me on portions... THEY HAD THE NERVE TO BRING ME THE RECEIPT AND HAVE ME SIGN IT ON TIME PRIOR TO GETTING MY FOOD. REALLY so i tip them and they disappear for over 15 minutes. I had to call the store and eventually walk inside to find the manager brush it off saying they needed to cook the chips. The manager wouldn't even give me the receipt back so I tipped them for absolutely nothing. This place is unprofessional and poorly run both staff and management. Never again.

Horrible service. Our server past us twice helping other people that were seated after we were. We finally had a host take our order. It's not even busy. Avoid this CPK. I'm surprised it even has three stars.

NEVER again!!!! This CPK Dine-in Express was just horrible and had the worst service. I just ordered a salad and pasta. How can the pasta be colder than your salad? I sent it back and it still wasn't good. It's also not crowded and we have to keep flagging our waiter down. Don't waste your time. You'll thank me later.
Love the chicken, spinach and artichoke pizza, and they have some good margaritas. Good family restaurant. You could also sit outside and enjoy the cool breeze
I like to eat at California pizza kitchen the food is delicious and the service is great!

One of the great things about this place is that there's something on the menu for pretty much the whole family. Our server Nancy was great...friendly, polite, accommodating and prompt. I had to give 3 stars because the floor was so dirty (as if kids ate at our table before us, but it wasn't cleaned-up) when we arrived, their parking was so congested that it took 17 minutes to find a spot, the music was SO LOUD and a genre that only a rave-goer would approve of (if they were raving). So loud in fact that talking across the table was a challenge. We left agitated, anxious and frustrated. Sorry CPK, I thought you should know.

I've been ordering to go quite a bit lately. For the most part it has been pretty solid. Sometimes the food isn't always ready when you go pick it up. (Tonight I had to wait 15 min. But the kitchen was short-staffed and the online ordering system didn't take that into account.) Food is good although a bit pricey.

Hard to believe a chain can be open for as long as CPK and still keep a DoorDash delivery person waiting nearly 2 HOURS for a salad and pasta. Terribly managed, and we will never order from this location again. Absurd.

The take-out service is absolutely awful. The pizzas were the wrong ones, not what we ordered. The salads were mostly just lettuce, virtually no chicken on them, and they gave us half a serving of dressing.  They also had the unbelievable nerve to give us bread that was literally just crusts. And no butter, just olive oil, even though we asked for butter. I went back to complain and saw the hostess who handled my order sitting at one of the tables eating dinner -- even thought there were patrons waiting.  What kind of management do they have at this place?

awesome  right next to my office . Not a first time here and like this place +5 .  Food taste so good and fresh.  Try blackberry fiz you will like it for sure  Not super busy , dont have to wait  This place has a great customer service

I feel like this place has been consistent in terms of service. Cooking  and selection, but the quality of the food is becoming slowly not as good as it used to be, I have a feel that the quality of the ingredients has been lowered... The ambience is great and the crowd really cool.

I have been a regular customer of CPK since 1994.  I am familiar with this CPK location via DoorDash.  Horrible service. I did not receive the requested food items, plus the quality of the food was poor.  I will never order from this CPK location again.
Customer service here was beyond my expectations today! Thanks to Dakota and Victoria the manager!.. and of course my Basil Martini was off the charts. See you all soon

I had lunch here yesterday, and when I got home, I realized that I had left my credit card at the restaurant. I was so thankful that it was there and locked up safely in the safe. I don't recall my waitress, but she had a smile that was wider than the street, and a very accommodating personality. I also loved the lunch special, and didn't feel discriminated against although I was eating by myself. This place is clean, friendly, with my only criticism being that the air-conditioning was a little too strong for me. Thank you for making my solo dining experience so memorable.

Actually, I eat there fairly regularly.  The new lunch duo menu rocks, but it's only for weekdays.  You "can" get the smaller portions on the weekend if you ask, but they will be slightly higher priced.  The Wild Mushroom pizza with double mushrooms is my fav. The staff is very friendly and welcoming, the menu items and cocktails are made consistently well.  The menu is varied and will please just about anyone.  The only downfall is the location, in the Culver Center, which is extremely crowded at all times, especially during lunch hours.  I've actually tried to stop in on the weekend for an early lunch (say 11:30 am) and left out of frustration due to no parking spaces available.  The only up side is that parking in the "green" loading zone in front is not monitored so cars are not towed so that's a possibility, but even then at times all spaces are taken.

At CPK, "pizza" is a relative term. This place serves up some of the worst I've ever tried.  What a ripoff.  Total crap.  I cannot believe what people will settle for and pay money for.  I will not be back.

I placed a large lunch order for work. I called right when they opened (11am) and spoke to the manager. I gave him my order over the phone for 11 people and said I needed it ready by 1pm. Jason, the manager, was very accommodating. He patiently waited on the phone while I told him each of the orders and had him write the names on each one. Once I got off the phone with him, someone else from work wanted to place their order in, so I had to call back 5 minutes later. Jason was really cool about it. All of the orders were correct and I had a pleasant experience with everyone involved.

Went to a game show filming and had dinner here. After going to Smash Burger (next door) for lunch, I expected the same type of dining experience, not being a Los Angeles resident. I have always loved the Mac and cheese and I thought that it wouldn't hurt to try it again. So glad I did! Just like old times. A good dinner or lunch destination for a hungry family or group.
My son and I loved our meals. I had the pesto cream penne and  my son had the chicken tequila. Delicious. Our waitress Kelley was kind and sweet. Always smiled. Highly recommend going here.
I went there and had Dakota C as a waiter. He was so friendly and gave us outstanding service. Hands down best waiter in LA county. The food was amazing too

Did curbside pick up to get lunch for the office. The lunch order was put in at 11:50am and was told the it would be ready at 12:50pm. I get there right about 12:55pm and call to let them know I was outside waiting for my food. I was told it was very busy and it would probably be another 15 minutes or so before the food was ready. I waited the 15 minutes and finally decided to just go inside to pick up the order. It took another 10 minutes of waiting inside to get my order. All in all, it took almost an hour and a half to get my food, from the time food was ordered until the food was actually in my hand. The food was only mediocre, not impressed.  Don't think we will be ordering from here anytime soon.

First time here and I got to tell you  Best service ever if the had more stars I would have given more  Efrain the manager he is awesome he really takes this business to a different level  I'm very happy with the service

Conveniently located and friendly service. The onsite manager is awesome too. There was a minor issue with my order and he quickly took care of it - very professional! We eat here at least twice a month...

Never had I ever been to a CPK before because with a title that has PIZZA in it, you'd assume there is ZERO things for me to eat at this restaurant! Since I'm NOT close minded though and I pay attention to food, I knew CPK had more offerings and when I was actually handed the menu, I was BLOWN AWAY at the expansive list of fare... Not including the pizzas! Halibut, Salmon, Roast Chicken, Ribeye... CPK caters to EVERY TYPE OF EATER and for those who suffer from food allergies- this place is your best friend!  When I mentioned I had food allergies, my amazing waitress came back with an allergen guide, which is oh so very important for those plagued with issues such as mine! I learned that a lot of items randomly have anchovies in them (things you wouldn't even think about- quesadillas, chicken wraps, etc), but luckily I love anchovies so if I could eat those items, I would have welcomed them with open arms! That being said, I wound up getting the 1/2 portion (YEAH I THOUGHT I WAS SICK TOO... Since when do I order 1/2 portions of anything) topped with BOTH GRILLED CHICKEN AND SALMON (redeeming my garbage disposal eating ways with that DOUBLE ORDER)... And when our food was presented to us, I was THRILLED with what I saw! The salad was HUGE AND BUSTING OFF THE PLATE with grilled veggies like eggplant and peppers and artichoke hearts... And the serving of chicken was SUPERB! The salmon serving was a bit smaller but honestly, this was the PERFECT sized salad for me (with the two protein toppings) that left me quite full and happy! I know if I ordered either the chicken or the salmon I would have been bummed. On top of this, the chicken and salmon were insanely flavorful (as were the veggies) that NO DRESSING at all was necessary, then again, I never really find dressing to be necessary.  My friend ordered the arugula and quinoa salad topped with chicken and she was insanely fond of her meal, and was shocked that she couldn't even finish it (she got the 1/2 portion too).  All in all, YES! YES! YES! CPK FOR THE WIN! I love this place and I'm definitely coming back!!  Side Notes: - Ample parking - The waitstaff are INSANELY NICE & helpful - Don't be scared to speak up about any modifications you want made on your meals  SO GOOD! :) pleasantly surprised for sure!

Have you ever felt as though your patronage was an inconvenience to a restaurant...that wasn't all that bust? That's my experience today at the CPK. The beginning of my dinning experience started off well enough. I ordered a glass of wine and a pizza. I waited far too long for my wine and after asking about it was told by the server that "I assumed you wanted to wait for it until your food arrived." Hmm...did I ask you to think for me? When the pizza finally arrived, it was burnt and lukewarm at best but I ate it without complaining as i didn't want to spend even more time waiting. Maybe they assumed I liked my food like that? After asking for the check, I had to wait another 15 minutes to pay as no one came to take my money. I just got up with the check and my money to pay anyone at the cash register but what do you know? My server came and took the money. So, I waited again for her to take her sweet time checking me out without so much as an apology.  I gave one star for cleanliness.
Very good service. I didn't realize the Mango-Strawberry drink didn't have free refills. Without even asking, who I presume was the manager, brought me a free soda instead

Skip the Curbside Service at this location. They don't do it here correctly. You'll call and they will try to upsell you 5 times on things you don't want, then when you come to pick up, the two spots for Curbside are always taken because it's in a very busy shopping center. So people just park there and this location doesn't police the spots. So you have to circle around and wait. Or. Just find another spot and hope the person can find you....when they actually ever come out. You call to tell them you're there, and they act surprised and as if you didn't just "press 2 to let us know you're outside."  So, your best bet is either to just eat in. Or call for a traditional take out and go in and get it. Curbside service here, if you can even get it done correctly, isn't any faster than just walking in and picking up from the Take Out window. And far more hassle.
Alfredo who works at take out counter is very rude, no greetings, no smile, no thank you. I went to pickup my order, and he simply said "not ready" with an attitude.

Came here for lunch to celebrate my sisters graduation with the fam. We were a group of 6 with 1 toddler. They didn't have space so we were seated outside in the patio area which we didn't mind. Our server was attentive and took our orders promptly. We had the spinach and artichoke dip which was delicious and creamy, next we had the split pea and barley soup which was a bit watery and lacked in taste. Our main course was the garlic and artichoke pizza which was soo good with a perfect combination of ingredients, crispy crust, and garlic was not over powering. Our server didn't come back after serving us so we had to wait a bit to get the check and flag her down. NOW here is why this gets two stars. This would of been a wonderful experience if it was not totally ruined by an ignorant and rude woman who was having some sort of business meeting with her colleagues and decided to comment loudly about how my sisters child was being too loud for her taste and how typical being at a restaurant with screaming kids. When the father proceed as ask what did she expect him to do and asked if he should put tape over his mouth and she says "that would be a good idea."  * Btw toddler only screamed out once to get out of his high chair and never cried or screamed since* Umm did she just crawl out if her hag hole? She is at a family friendly restaurant and yes children do cry and scream and parents do try to make the effort to calm the child without someone like her with her unintelligent comments. Seriously? She is seated in the patio area with a bunch of outside noise and strong wind, her head must be thick as f**k. If you can't stand to hear children, than please go rent a meeting hall or go to a bar/ pub restaurant with zero kids in sight to have your meeting, but if not than seriously consider putting tape over your ears :) California pizza kitchen your food was awesome and so was our server, we just didn't have a great experience and ruin the joy we had for my sister gradating. As for that detestable woman, I hope she is a regular and if you do read this and see her with pics I provided than please consider going else where with your children or ready your duct tape.

Came back to this location....why you ask I have no clue?! I was let down once again! Came on tonight at 9:30ish it was not very busy at all! Our server literally got our drinks took our order and I did not see him again until he brought our check. How's your meal? Can I get you a refill? Nothing...nothing at all! In fact I had to get up from my table two times to ask for more sauce for our pasta and to go get a refill. It's pretty sad that CPK clearly does not take pride in satisfying its customers. This is the 2nd we've had horrible service in the last three months and nothing has changed not one bit.  This will be the last time I ever eat at this restaurant, I will not spend money on a company that clearly doesn't take pride in their job!

My boyfriend and I just had dinner here, and we had a wonderful experience. The waitress was slammed (it was a full house), and the manager was assisting her. They were both so polite, so attentive, and the food was great!  One thing about my experience that wasn't so great, that I really feel the need to share, were the two tables on either side of us. Both parties were incredibly rude to the staff. To anyone reading this, please be aware that the staff works really hard to provide a good experience to their customers. Try a thank you, or be mindful of your language when expressing a frustration.  On that note, thank you so much to the manager, our waitress, and the very nice host! We will definitely be back.

My husband and friends are now regulars! This may be a small CPK but the staff are wonderful as well as the food! We LOVE their Potato cheese soup and can't get enough of it! Our most of the time waiter Irving is FABULOUS! He always asks us, "Are we having the soup again and what size?" We always laugh! For awhile we were going once a week and sometimes twice a week, as I was bringing my friends as well. Parking is sometimes a challenge depending on the time you go,because there is a gym in this center, but we always find parking not too far away! We love the convenience of this CPK, since it's close to where we live, and have never had any problems with the wait staff!  Next time ask for Irving, he is the BEST! :)

Best place ever!!!! First time going with the fiancé and it was outstanding! Our server was genuinely nice and very helpful, and the nice blond lady I'm guessing who was the manager there was outstanding and nice. Thank you for the best food and service!! Most def coming back

Delicious food and fast service. We went with my three young kids. The hostess immediately seated us with crayons and colors. Our waitress was very sweet with the kids and brought out drinks and bread immediately. Food was delicious. They also accept "pizza dough" which is discount offers through our AMEX.

Went recently for lunch to CPK for the first time in years and was excited. We were seated quickly and our drink orders were taken. Our waiter was friendly and helpful. We ordered and then it went south. We sat and waited for 30 minutes. Our server came by and told us things were crazy and we should get our pizza soon. When it came, there had been a mix up in the kitchen with our order. Instead of half meat free, they just put all the vegetables on 1 side and meat on everything. Our server apologized and put in our order again. It came 15 minutes later. It was underwhelming overall. I've had better pizza for much less and they didn't make me wait an hour for it. Would not recommend this place.

I'll never order from here again. They upcharge your card for their mistakes. I ordered a pizza and side salad through Grubhub. Side salad was listed as $3.00. Two hours later I get an email that CPK is upcharging my card $7.11 for "extras" in my order. Grubhub's customer care person was very helpful and called CPK manager to ask what my "extras" were. CPK's night manager said they meant to update menu with Grubhub and that side salads are now $6.49!  I never would have ordered a $6.49 side salad! Salad could fit in my hand- it was not worth $7.11 ($6.49, plus tax)! Essentially, CPK charged me almost $11 for a side salad (the initial, advertised $3 and the upcharging of $7.11). Grubhub credited back the intiial $3 but CPK manager insisted on the additional $7.11.  All of this could've been avoided if (1) CPK had called me when they got my order and asked me if I wanted a side salad at $7.11, or if (2) they updated their listed prices when they first noticed discrepancy.

location: South East LA, Los Angeles, CA
review: Late night craving last night for my fav. chicken tequila fettuccine was happy to find a cpk to be open until ten as most of them closed at nine.Great service. Small location but did not feel claustrophobic. Definetly will be stopping by again.

Honestly the food here was good...but the service was not that great. Everything took longer than it should have from getting water or the complimentary bread. Our food was sitting out for about 5 minutes before another server brought it . I think our server was just preoccupied with other things because he just wasn't around a lot and was constantly talking to other people and sitting at the table with them. Im happy the food was good at least.

I love California pizza kitchen. This location was exceptional. The arugula quinoa salad was so amazing and so was the garlic cream fettuccine. All their salads look so good I'm going to be trying every single one

I'm a regular customer of this location. Always had decent service until today. There were only about 8 customers inside, None outside, and 3 at the bar.  There were about 4 employees in sight. One of them looked like a manager because she wasn't wearing the uniform but I'm not sure.  We stood and waited to be seated for about 10min but no one ever came to greet us, give us a table, or show any kind of acknowledge. Very disappointing. Make your customers feel like you care about their business.

the customer service at this location was absolutely unacceptable. i am on disability and i order food for my family. when i went to pay for it my card was declined. why didn't they do something nice and help me out. they just threw away the food or ate in. this is very sad.

I went to the location today and spent $82.00. we got fresh iced teas a yummy spinach and artichoke dip for an appetizer. Two tequila Fettuccini alfredos , artichoke and spinach pizza with chicken, and two kids Mac n cheese. Everything came out perfect the food was of great portion and everything tasted really good. Our server was really sweet and the manager was pleasant as well. Our visit was at about 4pm so the outside seating was a great option. I'm sitting here eating my left overs five hours later and I just had to post a review on our visit. This wasn't my first time at this location but it was really good as usual.

I ordered the Jambalaya and asked for soft noodles since i'm not an al dente kind of girl. my dish was amazing! flavor was definitely on point. it's spicy but so very good. I do recommend you try it if you love spicy.

Be ready they will ask you to wait 25 minutes for five-cheese pizza. And then additional 8 minutes for that, because 25 minutes was not enough. Sunday, Sep 25, 4:30pm But the pizza is very good. So tasty!

We've been to this location a few times but last weekend when my fiance and i went we were waited by Andre. He was absolutely AMAZING. he made us feel well taken care of. we could not stop taking about how well his service was even after we left the restaurant. someone like that is rare to find now a days. He is definitely a keeper. :)

Food is good. Service, not so good. It took us a half hour to get water. Our server, well sucked. Ignored us most of the time. Our server never brought our water, we had to ask the person who brought our appetizers. She also had to bring the silverware and napkins. Food arrives, haven't seen our server in a half hour. Finally he comes back. Eventually the check arrives, but since our server didnt return, the manager processed it. All the other servers were tending to their customers pretty quickly while our guy was MIA. We won't be back to this location.

It's a chain, how can you mess it up? Whelp, just stop by this one and see for yourself. I live a couple blocks away and used to come here about once a week to take home some gluten free pizza as they make one of the best...usually. I order ahead of time and go shopping next door before, but I think they're watching me because somehow my order is never ready. Finally after about 10-15 mins, no exaggeration, I get my pizza. Once I get home, to my dismay it is always undercooked. I go ahead and heat up the oven because once I get it crispy it's quite good. The only reason I keep coming back is  Ecuador it's close to my house and 2 out of 5 times the pizza will be ready on time....still have to cook it more tho ;)

Girl at curbside pickup seemed frustrated and lazy. Literally rolled her eyes when I asked for water I that initially ordered over the phone. And the woman In the car next to me asked for something and as she walked away she dropped her arms and head back in frustration as she walked away. She also me waiting for over 5 minutes in my car to bring back my payment after handing me an ice cream brownie sundae in 100 degree weather. What's that about? Another time I called and it took the guy 8 minutes on the food with me in order to place an order for lettuce cups and a salad. There is NO REASON for the ordering process to take that long. By the time he finally placed the order and got off the phone with me it would take another 20 mins to be ready...and now I'm only 10 minutes out.  He told me I needed to come in and get the water myself when I asked for a cup of water on the phone. Then I tried to order extra lettuce cups for my lettuce wraps and he told me I had to come in and ask for them. When I finally went in to confirm my order it was all correct. How is that considered CURBSIDE pickup?! Ugh.  According to one of the workers inside, the curbside orders are taken by a "call center" and they are rude to customers. They say to press 3 when you call in. That possibility is the only reason I'm not getting 2 stars.  Food consistent. Always cold inside. The customer service here is generally awful.

Bad Service. Ok Food. I called in an order for two pizzas and a slice of cake. The phone ordering process was too long. They said my order would be ready around 5:50pm. I arrived at 6:00pm and it wasn't ready! I was told it was being bagged up and then I waited 20 minutes! The ladies working take out seemed very overwhelmed and they were super inefficient.

I ordered a BBQ salad for take out... the full one, and I seriously only got 3 little pieces of chicken. This is so upsetting, why would you send that out!?!? How is that ok? I obviously can't comment on the service because it was takeout. this is exactly why I'm absolutely done with chain restaurants! Total ripoff!
Worst ever service and wait! Waited for more than 30 min for our food! The restaurant is not even full. Don't come here.
Food is average at best . Sometime it comes out piping hot, sometimes lukewarm and sometimes cold.  Service is slow. Worst of all we found a piece of plastic in the dipping oil.

Take out order of 3 kids macaroni & cheeses was told it would take 20 min. Got to the empty restaurant and waited an additional 15 min. Ridiculous. The place was empty. No one checking on order until I asked when it would be ready.  When asked if it usually takes this long at this time of day cashier didn't even look up from her paper and said "no. Not usually". When I asked why today she replied "I don't know".

Seems like everyone has the same problem with the location, very slow service. It took 45 min for our food to arrive, leaving us a few minutes to inhale our food to get back to work. They didn't even come check to see if we need drink refills. Food was delicious but unfortunately not worth the long wait. The management needs to get things in order. Sorry, won't be coming back

I came here for lunch with a large group of people and had an average experience. I understand that when you're part of a larger party things might move a little slower but this service was incredibly slow. My dish was just meh. I got the Brussels and bacon flatbread and it was stiff and room temperature. I will say the avocado rolls were absolutely delicious though. I most likely won't come back because there are plenty of other delicious restaurants to go to and try in Culver City.

I come here too often - no doubt. I only order one thing and that is the full size cheese pizza with light sauce! They get it perfect every time. I would definitely say it's my favorite "establishment chain" pizza. It's so good and you can really tell they use fresh ingredients! I hate when other pizza crust taste bland/like cardboard, not a problem here. Fresh crust. And free bread on the side! Customer service and take out is very fast and great too. Just wish they had more discounts.
Love love love the BBQ Chicken Salad and Pizza Here. We usually do curb side pick up and at times it's super efficient and other times it has taken so long I have to walk inside.
This was so awesome! My wife and I we've enjoyed service, food delicious, absolutely will be back!
This is for Lizz the waitress! She was excellent. Very attentive and kind. Food was good too!

They make wonderful gluten free pizzas. The service is always friendly helpful and accommodating. My wife and I really enjoy going here and will be back soon. We always ask for CPK gift cards for holiday gifts.

When CPK first opened in Cali i was a big fan. Then all of sudden like most popular chain restaurants their portions got smaller and prices increased. This is my first visit in over a year. I ordered the Waldorf salad. No chicken ADD salmon. It was delicious! Only one concern, the salmon was prepared cubed and well done. It really wasn't what I was expecting or what I wanted HOWEVER!! It was just as delicious as I remembered. My waitress (Yoseline)made a mean(as in DAMN GOOD)...i mean a mean lemon drop! It was the best drink I've had in a long time (all week to be exact and it's only Monday Lol) the service was excellent.  Thanks Yoseline and the host with the Justin Beiber haircut, very friendly.
